definition: a noble steed (literary)/(of a horse) untamed/(fig.) (of a person) headstrong/Taiwan pr. [ao2]
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
to stand on tiptoe and crane one's neck (idiom); fig. to yearn for sth
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
a black stallion or possibly a yellow mare (idiom); don't judge by outward appearance
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
straightforward and honest in one's actions (idiom)
to judge people based on their success or failure (idiom)
lit. the mountains crumble and the trees lie ruined/a great sage has died (idiom)
